required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Famciclovir Pediatric Formulation in Children 1 to 12 Years of Age With Herpes Simplex Infection
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label, Single-arm, Two-step Study to Evaluate the Safety and Single-dose Pharmacokinetics of Famciclovir and Multiple-dose Safety After Administration of Famciclovir Oral Pediatric Formulation to Children 1 to 12 Years of Age With Herpes Simplex Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This study will evaluate the safety and blood levels of a new pediatric formulation of Famvir in children 1-12 years of age. In Part A, patients will receive a single dose of famciclovir (12.5 mg/kg) to assess pharmacokinetics (PK) and safety. In Part B, patients will receive multiple doses of famciclovir alone or with concomitant oral anti-herpes therapy to assess safety and tolerability. Part B will start only after PK data from Part A had been analyzed.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of a Single-dose of Famciclovir in Part A of the Study.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours and 24 hours after study drug administration (Part A)
primary_outcome.description: A patient with multiple adverse events (AEs) within the primary system organ class is counted only once in total row.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration of Penciclovir (Cmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: plasma level measurements: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: PK parameter; penciclovir is the active metabolite of famciclovir.

primary_outcome.measure: Time of Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration of Penciclovir (Tmax)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Plasma level measurements: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: PK parameter; penciclovir is the active metabolite of famciclovir.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Penciclovir Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity (AUC0-∞)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Plasma level measurements: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: PK parameter; penciclovir is the active metabolite of famciclovir.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Plasma level measurements: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: PK parameter; penciclovir is the active metabolite of famciclovir.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Elimination Half-life of Penciclovir (T1/2)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Plasma level measurements: pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: PK parameter; penciclovir is the active metabolite of famciclovir

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and Tolerability of Famciclovir Pediatric Oral Formulation in Part B of the Study.
primary_outcome.description: A patient with multiple AEs within the primary system organ class is counted only once in total row.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part A of the Study.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall acceptability of the study medication was determined by caretaker response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part B of the Study.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at clinic: after swallowing first dose
secondary_outcome.description: Overall acceptability of the study medication was determined by caretaker response.

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part B of the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 8 at home: after swallowing last dose
secondary_outcome.description: Overall acceptability of study medication was determined by caretaker response.

intervention.description: Famciclovir sprinkle capsules, 25 mg and 100 mg, using OraSweet® syrup vehicle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- History or laboratory evidence of herpes simplex infection
- Clinical evidence or suspicion of herpes simplex infection
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients unable to swallow
- Concomitant use of probenecid
- Positive pregnancy test
Additional protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply. For detailed information on eligibility, please contact the study center nearest to you or call the following numbers: 1-862-778-3544 or 1-434-951-3228

facility.name: Kosair Charities Pediatric Clinical Research Unit
State University of New York at
Baylor College of Medicine/Texas Children's Hospital

group.title: Part A (Single-dose of Famciclovir)
group.description: Includes 27 patients enrolled in Part A. Two adolescent patients (13 to 18 years) were enrolled in Part A of this study under an amendment to the protocol to include adolescent aged patients. The amendment was rescinded in compliance with an FDA Pediatric Written Request and no further adolescent aged patients were enrolled.

group.title: Part B (Multiple-dose of Famciclovir)
group.description: Includes 47 patients enrolled in Part B. Part B started only after pharmacokinetic (PK) data from Part A had been analyzed. One patient that participated in Part A of the study also participated in Part B.

group.title: Part A (Single-dose of Famciclovir)
group.description: Each patient in Part A received a single dose of famciclovir (12.5 mg/kg).

group.title: Part B (Multiple-dose of Famciclovir)
group.description: Each patient in Part B received famciclovir twice a day (b.i.d.) approximately 12 hours apart for 7 days for a total of 14 doses. An 8-step dosing scheme (ranged from 150 mg b.i.d. to 500 mg b.i.d.) was used to determine the weight-based adjusted daily dose.

outcome.title: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part A of the Study.
outcome.description: Overall acceptability of the study medication was determined by caretaker response.
outcome.population: Includes all 27 patients enrolled in Part A of the study.

measure.title: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part A of the Study.
measure.description: Overall acceptability of the study medication was determined by caretaker response.
measure.population: Includes all 27 patients enrolled in Part A of the study.

outcome.title: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part B of the Study.
outcome.description: Overall acceptability of the study medication was determined by caretaker response.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at clinic: after swallowing first dose
outcome.population: Includes all 47 patients enrolled in Part B of the study.

measure.title: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part B of the Study.
measure.description: Overall acceptability of the study medication was determined by caretaker response.
measure.population: Includes all 47 patients enrolled in Part B of the study.

outcome.title: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part B of the Study
outcome.description: Overall acceptability of study medication was determined by caretaker response.
outcome.time_frame: Day 8 at home: after swallowing last dose
outcome.population: Includes all 47 patients enrolled in Part B of the study. Response was not available for 1 patient in the 2 to <6 years and 6 to <=12 years groups.

measure.title: Overall Acceptability of Pediatric Oral Formulation by Patients in Part B of the Study
measure.description: Overall acceptability of study medication was determined by caretaker response.
measure.population: Includes all 47 patients enrolled in Part B of the study. Response was not available for 1 patient in the 2 to <6 years and 6 to <=12 years groups.

reported_events.time_frame: Patients in Parts A and B of the study who experienced adverse events. These AEs are presented by system organ class for each age group in the safety population.

group.description: Includes 27 patients enrolled in Part A. Two adolescent patients (13 to 18 years) were enrolled in Part A of this study under an amendment to the protocol to include adolescent aged patients. The amendment was rescinded in compliance with an FDA Pediatric Written Request and no further adolescent aged patients were enrolled.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single-site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e., data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
